column4: Hey there.  Does anyone know how to map windows key (super L) + E to open file explorer in ubuntu 8.10?
gconf-editor
>>apps>>metacity
>>keybinding_commands
just follow the directions,easier that way

so, do I simply go to the keyboard shortcuts section in preferences?  I've already tried that, and it seems that the gnome keyboard shortcuts don't support windows key (super L) + someletter combinations.
run gconf-editor in Alt+F2
alt+f2 == cli / console?
key combination in GUI
what happened?
just making sure that I don't screw things up, and its taking another moment.   brb.
Where do I go in gconf editor
press Alt+F2 on your desktop,type gconf-editor and press Enter,in the window that opens,follow />>apps>>metacity>>keybinding_commands>>edit command 1 to read nautilus
now I understand.  I'm sorry that the coffee hasn't kicked in yet.  :)
lol,nevermind
is it possible to create new commands for combinations like super L / windows key + R for run, and super L / windows key + E for opening nautilus?
only new key combinations
have you finished editing command 1 to read nautilus?
does "new key combinations" equate to the ability to create superL+R, etc?
yes
alrighty, let me try this.... momentito....
